jparsec.astrophysics

Class HRDiagram

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.astrophysics.HRDiagram

  • public class HRDiagram
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows to work with HR diagrams and to fit or calibrate those coming from observations of star clusters.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor for an HR diagram using experimental data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HRDiagram

        public HRDiagram(double[] T,
         double[] m,
         java.lang.String source)
        Constructor for an HR diagram using experimental data.
        Parameters:
        T - The set of effective temperatures.
        m - The set of apparent magnitudes in V band.
        source - The source name.

      • HRDiagram

        public HRDiagram(boolean showGiants,
         boolean showSuperGiants,
         int np,
         int minTef,
         int maxTef)
          throws JPARSECException
        Creates a synthetic HR diagram with absolute magnitude as function of effective temperature.
        Parameters:
        showGiants - True to show also giant stars.
        showSuperGiants - True to show also supergiant stars. Giant stars must be shown or this flag will have no effect.
        np - Number of points in the diagram. 100 will use 100 points for main sequence stars, another 100 for giants, and 100 more for supergiants.
        minTef - The minimum effective temperature for the points.
        maxTef - The maximum effective temperature for the points.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

    • Method Detail

      • getChart

        public CreateChart getChart(boolean invert)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Returns a chart with the HR diagram.
        Parameters:
        invert - True to inver X and y axes.
        Returns:
        The chart.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • fitDistance

        public void fitDistance(HRDiagram hr,
               double minMag,
               double tolerance)
                 throws JPARSECException
        Fits this HR diagram with another one, setting the value of the distance.
        Parameters:
        hr - The HR diagram to fit to.
        minMag - Minimum value of the visual magnitude for the region where the main sequence starts and extends below for fainter stars.
        tolerance - The tolerance or desired quality of the fit in magnitudes.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getDistance

        public double getDistance()
        Returns the distance to the source.
        Returns:
        Distance in pc.

      • fitTurnOffPoint

        public void fitTurnOffPoint(double minT,
                   double maxT,
                   double minMag,
                   double maxMag,
                   double tolerance)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Compute the turnOff point of the cluster.
        Parameters:
        minT - Minimum temperature of the region with the main sequence.
        maxT - Maximum temperature of the region with the main sequence.
        minMag - Minimum value of the magnitude of the region with the main sequence.
        maxMag - Maximum value of the magnitude of the region within the main sequence.
        tolerance - Tolerance or desired error of the fitting in magnitudes.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getTurnOffPointMagnitude

        public MeasureElement getTurnOffPointMagnitude()
        Returns the turn-off point magnitude.
        Returns:
        Turn-off point.

      • getTurnOffPointTemperature

        public MeasureElement getTurnOffPointTemperature()
        Returns the turn-off point effective temperature.
        Returns:
        Teff of the turn-off point.

      • clone

        public HRDiagram clone()
        Clones this instance.
        Overrides:

      • renderHRbranches

        public void renderHRbranches(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                    java.awt.Color mainSequence,
                    java.awt.Color giant,
                    java.awt.Color sgiant,
                    java.awt.Color whiteDwarf)
                      throws JPARSECException
        Draws the different branches of the HR diagram to a Graphics2D device. The Graphics instance should be previosuly 'prepared' using the method CreateChart.prepareGraphics2D(Graphics2D, boolean).
        Parameters:
        g - A 'prepared' Graphics2D instance of an image where the HR diagram was previosuly drawn using the method of this instance.
        mainSequence - Color for the main sequence branch, or null to skip drawing it.
        giant - Color for the giant branch, or null to skip drawing it.
        sgiant - Color for the super giant branch, or null to skip drawing it.
        whiteDwarf - Color for the white dwarf branch, or null to skip drawing it.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown in case of error when rotating the shape of the white dwarf branch, but should never happen.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Test program.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
